Podes agregar cubos personalizados a la lista. Para hacerlo, usa KubeBuilder para crear algun cubo especifico y copia el ID debajo.
El ID se encuentra en la ventana de detalles.

Estadisticas
Build3r
Build3r
Siguiente >
< Anterior

The Build3r is a GreaseMonkey script that allows you to synch a Kub3dit's map with the game.

To make it work you just have to use Chrome or Firefox (with GreaseMonkey plugin) and to install Build3r extension by clicking on the following link :
http://fevermap.org/kub3dit/gm/build3r.user.js

Once installed check if the following button appears under the minimap :



Click on it to open the Build3r.
For more details about it, go to the next page.

Once you opened the panel, you'll have the choice to load a map from a kub3dit's file or by it's URL's ID if you've uploaded it on the server

For this first test, let's load a map with the ID "1f" (no password). The map represents a 3D heart.
You should have the following screen :

This screen lets you synch the game with the map. Even if this manipulation looks unclear, it's actually quite simple.

You simply have to click a cell of the grid, for example the red one of the 1st level which is the heart's base, then, in the game, place a forum kube where you want this kube (the heart's base) to be.
Then click on the forum. You should hear an acute sound meaning that the map is synchronized with the game.

Click on the OK button at the bottom right to see and use the map.

By default you'll see a 2D representation of the map. You can use the sliders to scale, rotate or change level of the map.

Now click on the 2D button at the top to get an isometric view that will give you a better representation of the construction. You should get this :

Note nonetheless that the 2D rendering is more readable.
Now you just have to reproduce the map.

BUT what makes the Build3r's power isn't to just get the map aside the game, but to help building it.
Indeed, at one time or another you will get a doubt about where or what type of kube you should put. In this case, you have two solutions. Look at the map in details during more or less time, OR simply put a forum kube and touch it so that the Build3r will tell you which kube you have to put at this place.

Try to reproduce the heart now ;)




PS : Think about the U key to remove the forum without loosing energy ;)
